description.@value: Government Documents Librarian who does a substantial about of work researching and finding OER resources for faculty.

I am a PhD candidate in Educational Policy, Planning, and Leadership with an emphasis in Open Education. My doctoral research engages with theoretical foundations for open education, policy analysis, and trans-disciplinary sharing of open practice. I have also been working with the Virginia Dept. of Education over the last year in developing their OER adoption program, GoOpenVA.
I'm most interested in how open education can sustainably transform our educational institutions into more democratic and equitable forms.

The themes for the 13th Annual Open Education Conference are listed below. The organisers would like to express their thanks to everyone in the #OpenEd16 community for their ideas, contributions, and feedback during the selection of this yearâ€™s conference themes.
  • the meaning of open
  • open pedagogy and open educational practices
  • research on the impact of OER, open pedagogy, or open educational practices
  • the ethics of open
  • critiques of OER and open education
  • the economics of open education
  • issues at the intersection of open and assessment tools and technologies supporting open education
  • collaborations in support of open education promoting and evaluating institutional and governmental open policies
  • lessons learned from â€œless successfulâ€ open education initiatives
  • models supporting the adoption, use, or sustaining of OER in higher education
  • models supporting the adoption, use, or sustaining of OER in K-12 education
  • models supporting the adoption, use, or sustaining of OER in informal learning
  • models supporting the adoption, use, or sustaining of OER in adult basic education
  • the role of students in advocating for, supporting, or sustaining OER adoption and use
  • the role of faculty in advocating for, supporting, or sustaining OER adoption and use
  • the role of instructional designers in advocating for, supporting, or sustaining OER adoption and use
  • the role of librarians in advocating for, supporting, or sustaining OER adoption and use
  • synergies between open education and open data, open access, open science, and open source
  • open education in developing countries
  • whatâ€™s next for OER and open education
  • unanticipated topics (does your topic not fit above? it fits here!)
